citation.article-title: Lactobacillus pentosus, (Fred, Peterson and Anderson) sp. nov., nom. rev.

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus pentosus sp. nov., nom. rev.

Cells are rod shaped (1 to 1.2 μm by 2 to 5 μm) with rounded ends, straight, and may occur singly, in pairs or short chains. Gram positive. Nonmotile. Grows at 10 and 40°C but not at 45°C. Facultatively anaerobic. Facultatively heterofermentative producing D- and L-lactic acid. Acid is produced from amygdalin, L-arabinose, arbutin, cellobiose, D-fructose, galactose, β-gentiobiose, gluconate, D-glucose, glycerol, N-acetylglucosamine, lactose, D-mannose, mannitol, maltose, melibiose, raffinose, ribose, salicin, sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, and D-XylOSe. Acid is not produced from amidon, D-arabinose, L-arabitol, adonitol, erythritol, Dfucose, L-fucose, 2-ketogluconate, glycogen, 5-ketogluconate, inositol, inulin, α-methyl-D-mannoside, β-methylxyloside, D-lyxose, L-sorbose, D-tagatose, L-xylose, and xylitol. Some strains produce acid from D-arabitol, dulcitol, melezitose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, rhamnose, and D-turanose. Esculin is hydrolyzed. Catalase and arginine dihydrolase are not produced. Voges-Proskauer positive. Acid and clot produced in litmus milk.
Murein is the directly cross-linked type based on meso-diaminopimelic acid.
Guanine-plus-cytosine content of DNA ranges from 46.1 to 47.2 mol% (Tm).
Isolated from corn silage, fermenting olives, and sewage.
The type strain is NCDO 363 (= ATCC 8041).
In most respects the description of the type strain resembles the description of the species.
The type strain produces acid from rhamnose and D-turanose; acid is not produced from D-arabitol, dulcitol, and melezitose.
